data.title: Keithley Funeral Chapel Obituaries
data.meta_description: Find latest and historic obituaries from Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel Funeral Home. Browse online obituary listings, condolences, and funeral service information.
data.meta_site_name: Eulogy Assistant - Funeral Writing Support Service

Introduction to Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel

Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel, located at 2509 Vine, Hays, KS, 67601, is a trusted and compassionate funeral home that has been serving the Hays community for many years. With a long history of providing exceptional funeral services, the chapel has established itself as a beacon of hope and support during difficult times. In this article, we will delve into the history, services, and facilities of Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel, highlighting what sets them apart from other funeral homes in the area.

A Brief History of Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel

Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel has a rich history that dates back to the early 20th century. Founded by a group of dedicated individuals who were passionate about providing dignified and respectful funeral services, the chapel has undergone several transformations over the years to become the esteemed institution it is today. From its humble beginnings to its current state-of-the-art facilities, Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel has remained committed to its core values of compassion, integrity, and excellence.

Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel

Address: 2509 Vine, Hays, KS, 67601

Phone Number: 1-785-625-3215

Get Direction: Google Maps Link

Funeral Obiturary Search

Explore our extensive database to find and remember the lives of loved ones through millions of heartfelt obituaries

Recent Funeral Home Obituaries

Annabelle McCabe - Unknown - February 28, 2023

Departed: 02/28/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Annabelle McCabe, age 91, of Hays, Kansas passed away Tuesday, February 28, 2023 at HaysMed. She was born July 19, 1931 in Hays to Annas and Victoria (Meis) Pfannenstiel. She is survived by sons, Thomas Wasinger and wife Christine, and John Wasinger and wife Theresa all of Hays as well as numerous nieces, nephews and grandchildren. Private family services will be held. Condolences may be shared with family at www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com Arrangements in care of Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601.

View Full Obituary

Dennis "Joe" Pflaum - Unknown - February 16, 2023

Departed: 02/16/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Dennis "Joe" Pflaum, age 75 of Hays, Kansas passed away Thursday, February 16, 2023 at HaysMed. Joe was born on November 5, 1947 in Falls City, Nebraska to Albert and Leola (Wissman) Pflaum. On October 5, 1969 he married Vicki (Furnas) in the Falls City Methodist Church. Joe was the owner of Brown’s Shoe Fit in Hays for 41 years. In addition to owning the store he drove an Athletic Bus for Fort Hays State, drove a flagger vehicle for Hess Services moving oilfield tanks, as well as helping with car transports for local car dealerships. Joe was an avid outdoorsman particularly hunting and fishing and enjoyed traveling the country. His greatest joy was being able to attend his grandchildren’s sporting events. He is survived by his wife, Vicki Pflaum of Hays; his son, Aaron Matthew Pflaum and significant other, Stacy Budig and his children, twin girls, Brooke and Brittany and his son, Blake all of Hays; his daughter, Lindsay Hart and husband Jamie and their son, Braxton all of hays; two sisters, Rosie Wanchisen of Denver, Colorado and Joyce Neilsen and husband Jim of Broomfield, Colorado as well as his nieces and nephews. He was preceded in death by his parents,; a brother, Kenny Pflaum and his wife Lori; and a brother-in-law, Tom Wanchisen. Funeral services will be 1:00 PM Wednesday, February 22, 2023 at the First United Methodist Church of Hays with pastor Troy Miller officiating. Private family burial will take place in Falls City. Memorial contributions are suggested to HaysMed Hospice, Kansas Department of Wildlife and Parks or the Cancer Council of Ellis County. Donations made payable to the organization may be sent in care of Keithley Funeral Homes, PO Box 86 Hays, KS 67601. Condolences may be left by guest book at www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com Arrangements in care of Brock’s-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601.

View Full Obituary

Chris Gottschalk - Unknown - February 14, 2023

Departed: 02/14/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Chris Anthony Gottschalk of Hays, Kansas passed away in his home Tuesday, February 14, 2023. He was born in Manhattan, Kansas on May 18, 1959, to Cecil and Dorothy (Befort). Chris graduated from TMP in 1977. On November 17, 1979, he married Krista Leiker at St. Joseph Catholic Church in Hays. Chris worked in the oil field for most of his career. Through a life spent on the wells, he made life-long friends and considered many in his cohort his extended family. He leaves behind a lasting legacy in Kansas oil, notable both for his accomplishments in the industry and for those whose lives he touched. Chris lived life to its fullest. As a life-long Kansas City Chiefs fan, he was thrilled to watch his team win the Super Bowl this year. In true Chris fashion, he enjoyed the game surrounded by family and friends while hosting the best gameday party in town. His love of life was only outweighed by his generosity toward others, a trait for which he will be well-remembered. He was actively involved with Thomas More Prep-Marian serving as the Vice President of the Alumni board. From the sideline to the board room, Chris was a devoted supporter of TMP. Few things brought him as much joy as his years spent watching his kids and grandkids participate in all of their activities. He was a member of St. Joseph Church, a 3rd Degree Knights of Columbus, #4166, Schoenchen, and the Friday Morning OPEC Group “Oil Producers of Ellis County”. Chris is survived by his wife Krista Gottschalk, his 3 children Tyler Gottschalk (Megan) of Hays, Luke Gottschalk (Jessica) of Houston, Texas, and Katelyn Burkman (Nate) of Ellicott City, Maryland; 5 siblings, Gregg Gottschalk (Patricia) of Hays, Galen Gottschalk of Hays, Troy Gottschalk (April) of Westminster, Colorado, Jan Meade (Joe) of The Colony, Texas, and Becky Serri (Andy) of Sarasota, Florida; and 8 Grandchildren, Teagan Gottschalk, Adilyn Gottschalk, Jonah Gottschalk, Remington Gottschalk, Lily Gottschalk, Miles Gottschalk, Emerson Burkman, and Donovan Burkman. He is preceded in death by his parents; a God-child Shane Gottschalk, and his father-in-law Don Leiker. Funeral services will be 10:30 AM Friday, February 17, 2023, at St. Joseph's Catholic Church in Hays. Services will be available on Facebook Live as well by going to www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com and select the tab Facebook Live. Visitation will be Thursday 5:30 PM - 8:00 PM at the church with a combined rosary and parish vigil will be 7:00 PM. Arrangements in care of Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601.

View Full Obituary

Thomas A. "Tom" Koerner - Unknown - February 06, 2023

Departed: 02/06/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Thomas (Tom) Allen Koerner, 79, Hays, died February 6, at home. He was born July 11, 1943 in Hays, KS to Joseph and Bertha (Miller) Koerner and grew up in Hays. He married Sheila Sheck and later married Judy K. Giebler on June 11, 1977 in Hays. He was a 1961 graduate of St. Joseph’sMilitary Academy, joined the Air Force after graduation and was stationed in Korea and Okinowa during the Viet Nam era. He was a City Commissioner 1975-79, received his degree in Criminal Justice and worked at Larned Correctional Mental Health Facility as Staff Development Specialist. Tom worked in Pest Control, Farmers State Bank Loan Officer and many different jobs. His memberships included Immaculate Heart of Mary Catholic Church, St. Mary’s Third Degree Knights of Columbus Council #6984, and the Bishop Cunningham Fourth Degree Knights of Columbus Assembly. His careers in law enforcement were: Sergeant with Staff Development at Larned Mental Health Correctional Facility, Police Officer with the Hays Police Dept., Sheriff’s Deputy with Ellis County Sheriff’s Dept. On January 3, 2009, he was ordained a Permanent Deacon with the Salina Diocese and served at Immaculate of Heart Mary Church in Hays, KS until his retirement. Survivors include his wife of the home, a son, Scott Koerner (Vicki), daughter Christine Torres (Jesse), daughter Wanda Sue Keefover (Mike), son Bob Herman, brother Randy Koerner (Wanda); Sister-in-law Nancy Leiker, 7 grandchildren; 6 step-grandchildren, 1 great-grandchild, 15 step great-grandchildren. He was preceded in death by his parents and a daughter Terra Davis, brothers Myron (Skip), Joseph Koerner, & a brothers-in-law, Fred Weber, Jr., Lee Allan Leiker, a step great grandson, Aiden Keefover. Funeral services will be 10:00 AM Saturday, February 11, 2023 at Immaculate Heart of Mary Church in Hays. Burial with military honors courtesy of the Hays VFW Honor Guard will follow in St. Joseph's Cemetery. Visitation will be Friday 5 PM - 8 PM at Immaculate Heart of Mary Church. A Daughters of Isabella rosary service will be at 6 PM followed by a combined St. Mary's/IHMC Council 3rd degree and Bishop Cunningham 4th degree Knights of Columbus rosary at 6:45 with a parish vigil service following. Arrangements in care of Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601.

View Full Obituary

Betty Ziegler - Unknown - February 05, 2023

Departed: 02/05/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Betty Jean Ziegler, age 76, passed away on Sunday, February 5, 2023, at Long Term Care, in WaKeeney, KS. Betty was born at St. Anthony’s Hospital in Hays, KS, on September 20, 1946, to Ignatz and Mary (Weber) Beer. She was the oldest of four daughters. She attended school in Wakeeney, KS, graduating from Trego Community High School in 1964. Upon graduating, she worked keeping books at the local telephone company in Wakeeney. Betty married Lawrence “Max” Ziegler on August 6, 1966, at Christ The King Church in Wakeeney, KS. To this union, they were blessed with three children. Betty and “Max” made their home on the Ziegler family farm. Betty was a homemaker and helped her husband on the farm; she was a devoted wife and mother. She loved to cook, and we enjoyed many delicious meals especially during the holidays, no one left hungry. She also enjoyed playing Bridge with the Collyer group, and she was also involved in the St Michael's Catholic Church Altar Society. Betty liked to garden; she was not much into flowers, but enjoyed watching the vegetables grow. There was a lot of salsa made and oh my, the pumpkins. Betty enjoyed playing cards with her family as there were several evenings spent playing Dingbat, Pinochle, or Poker. She also enjoyed her trips gambling with her sisters and brother-in-laws, and she bowled for many years on a league with her family and friends. They went to national tournaments, always having a good time, and had stories to tell about their trips. Fulfilling his term, Betty also served on the school board after her husband, Max passed in 1990. Betty enjoyed being outside and spent many hours mowing with the riding mower while on the farm. Her favorite Holiday was Christmas. Everyone enjoyed all of the outside and inside decorations that were put up. Folks would drive by the farm to see them. Betty also grew up in a family that loved music. She learned to play the piano growing up and sang in choir. Betty taught piano lessons, and for many years, she was the song leader at St. Michael’s Catholic Church. She passed her love of music onto her children and grandchildren as all of her children and grandchildren can sing and/or play an instrument. Betty was diagnosed with Parkinson’s in 2004. She moved into Long Term Care in July of 2016 as the disease had progressed. Betty put up a good fight, but the last year had taken its toll, and she has now been called to her eternal home. Betty was preceded in death by her husband, “Max” Ziegler, and her parents. Betty is survived by her children, Charlene (David) Anderson, Wakeeney; Amy (Pete) Befort, Hays; Lance (Libby) Ziegler Wakeeney. Seven grandchildren, Max and Marissa Befort; Emma (Aaron) Satran, and Benjamin Anderson; Avery, Bailey, and Cenley Ziegler; Betty’s sisters, Carol (Vernon) Kinderknecht, Donna (Larry) Keyser, and Sharon (the late Virgil) Uhrich. Betty also has many beloved nieces and nephews. Funeral services will be 10:30 AM Friday, February 10, 2023 at St. Michael Catholic Church in Collyer, Kansas. Burial will follow in the church cemetery with a luncheon in the Collyer church basement. Visitation will be Friday 9:00 AM until service time at the church. Arrangements in care of Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601.

View Full Obituary

Wanda Pilkington - Unknown - February 03, 2023

Departed: 02/03/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Wanda Lou Pilkington, age 91, of Hays, Kansas passed away Friday, February 3, 2023 at Rush County Memorial Hospital Long Term Care Unit. She was born December 6, 1931 in Colby, Kansas to Nick and Marcella (Schlyer) Eberle. She married John E. Pilkington July 30, 1950. He preceded her in death on July 15, 2004. Wanda had worked as a telephone operator for Southwestern Bell starting in Colby, then Norton and finally Hays. She also was the bookkeeper for her husband’s business, Pilkington Construction. Wanda enjoyed being a grandmother and attending their sporting events, rarely if ever missing one. She also enjoyed crocheting and counted cross stitching as well as spending time with John fishing, boating, camping and an occasional casino trip for good measure. Wanda is survived by her children, Sandi Scott of Hays, John Pilkington and wife Carla of Oakley and Don Pilkington and wife Mary of Louisville, Colorado; 8 grandchildren and 9 great grandchildren. She was preceded in death by her parents, husband; a daughter, Tami Pilkington and two sisters, Jeannie Dreiling and Judy Wintz. Funeral services will be 10:00 AM Wednesday, February 8, 2023, at Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601. Burial will follow in St. Joseph's Cemetery, Hays. Visitation will be Tuesday 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM and Wednesday 9:00 AM until service time all at Brock's Chapel. Memorial contributions are suggested to the Hays Christian Church. Condolences may be left by guest book at www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com

View Full Obituary

Dwight Wagner - Unknown - February 03, 2023

Departed: 02/03/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Dwight Wagner, age 88, of Larned, Kansas, passed away on February 3, 2023. He was born March 18, 1934, to Edwin and Mabel Edna (Hinkel) Wagner in Ness City, Kansas. He graduated Ness City High School in 1953, he then served in the United States Army as a German Interpreter for four years. After service, he enjoyed many jobs in his life, but found his joy and calling at Larned State Hospital as a Licensed Mental Health Technician II, where he worked for 14 years. He was a lifetime member of the VFW. Loved spending time at the Welcome Inn in Larned where he shared about his love of hunting and fishing. Dwight also loved to ride Harleys, bowling and was an avid domino player. At one time, he played 26 games in one day. He is survived by one son, Curtis D. (Brenda) Wagner of Larned, Kansas. He was preceded in death by his parents Edwin and Mabel Wagner, two brothers, Gene and Willie, and one sister, Donna. Cremation has taken place. A celebration of life and memorial will be held at a later date. Arrangements are in care of Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601.

View Full Obituary

Mary Ann Befort - Unknown - January 31, 2023

Departed: 01/31/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Mary Ann Befort, 90 years old, passed away on January 31, 2023 in Lacrosse, Kansas. She was born October 7, 1932 in Hays, Kansas to Leo and Emma Gabel. She married Earl Befort on November 10, 1955. Mary Ann worked as a school cook for USD 489 in Hays, as well as a secretary for Ralph Hunter, and a bookkeeper for Munjor water district. She was a member of the St. Francis of Assisi Catholic Church in Munjor. She enjoyed sewing, spending time with her grandchildren and hosting special holiday meals. She is survived by two sons, Jake Befort and his wife Mitzi of Bison, KS and Lyle Befort and his wife Linda of Sublette, KS; six grandchildren, Amy Davidson and her husband Michael, Ryan Befort and his wife Sarah, Morgan Befort, Dusti Befort, Kali Befort, Dawn Befort as well as six great-grandchildren; brothers Melvin Gabel, Salina, KS; Robert Gabel, Colorado; and Hilarius Gabel, Colorado. She was preceded in death by her parents, husband, and brothers, Gilbert, Herbert, and Vernon Gabel. Funeral services will be 10:00 AM on Monday, February 6, 2023 at St. Francis of Assisi Catholic Church in Munjor. Inurnment will follow in the church cemetery. Memorial visitation will be Sunday 5PM - 7PM with a combined vigil and rosary at 7PM all at Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory, 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601. Memorial contributions are suggested to TMP-Marian High School. Condolences may be shared by guest book at www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com

View Full Obituary

Henry Mason Sellers - Unknown - January 31, 2023

Departed: 01/31/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Henry (Hank) Mason Sellers, son of W D Sellers and Mildred L (Jenkins) Sellers was born on October 9, 1945 in Fort Worth, TX. He died peacefully at home on January 31, 2023 at the age of 77. Henry lived his early life in Texas until his family moved to Kiowa, KS. He was a graduate of the Class of 1964 Hays High School. On November 18, 1964 he was united in marriage to Patricia Pierce at Hays, Kansas. This union was blessed with three children: Margaret, Christine and Katherine. He was a member of the Episcopal Church. Hank worked as a guidance counselor at St. Francis' Boys Home in Ellsworth, KS. He worked in the Kansas oilfields and as a truck driver, then moved to off-shore oil explorations in the Indian Ocean/South China Sea, Southeast Asia & The Norwegian Sea, Norway in his younger years while supporting his family. Hank worked on the Sellers Cattle Ranch for several years managing and involving the family with gardening & geese wrangling. Then he worked at Briggs Auto Group in Manhattan, KS for 12 years. Afterward, he had various sales positions until he began a new venture as safety manager in the shale play oil exploration in the Pennsylvania area. Those who preceded him in death are his parents, Dub & Mildred Sellers, his sister Patsy Kanak, two great-granddaughters Meredith and Macie Sellens, his wife of 36 years Patricia Pierce and other remembered family members. Survivors include his brother, Donnie Sellers (Lois) of Russell, KS, three daughters: Margaret Sellers of Kansas City, Missouri, Christine Sellers of Russell, Kansas and Katherine Sellers (Rick Meis) of Russell, Kansas. Also surviving are his granddaughters: Angela (Miller) Meyer (Patrick) of Adrian, Missouri, Jamie Crawford of St. John, Kansas, Randi Steinle (Randy Leiderbach) of Yukon, Oklahoma and Chandler Reich-Sellens (Jake) of Russell, Kansas. His great grandchildren: Edwin, Porter, Veda, Reese, Adler and a number of other family. The family will be having a private celebration of life service at a later date. Arrangements in care of Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601. Condolences may be left by guest book at www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com

View Full Obituary

Jack Samples - Unknown - January 30, 2023

Departed: 01/30/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Jack M. Samples, age 90, of Hays, Kansas passed away Monday, January 30, 2023 at the Good Samaritan Society, Hays. He was born July 3, 1932, at Skiatook, OK, to William and Gertrude (Montgomery) Samples. Jack graduated from Hays High School in 1950 and took a year of college at Fort Hays Kansas State College. He worked for Central Exploration Co., and Skelly Oil Co. before marrying Patty J. Binder on July 20,1952, at Hays. She passed away January 19, 2006. Jack was drafted into the U. S. Army in December of 1952, and served 2 years during the "Korean War," before receiving an Honorable Discharge in December 1954, with the rank of Sergeant. He then worked several months for the University of California, out of Los Alamos, NM. For approximately 30 years he worked as an "Office and Field Clerk" for Skelly Oil Co., Getty Oil Co., and Texaco. He is survived by four grandchildren. He was preceded in death by daughter, Keri L. Pendleton of Fontana, CA, on May 15, 2007 and a brother, William D. Samples. Visitation will be Thursday, February 2, 2023, 9:00 AM - 2:00 PM at Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601. Private burial will follow in Mt. Allen Cemetery, Hays. Condolences may be left by guest book at www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com

View Full Obituary

Marion Schumacher - Unknown - January 29, 2023

Departed: 01/29/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Marion D. Schumacher, age 83, of Munjor, Kansas passed away Sunday, January 29, 2023 at HaysMed. He was born May 21, 1939 in Ellis County, Kansas on the farm near Victoria to Alois “Shorty” and Mary (Jacobs) Schumacher. On April 12, 1958 he married Natalie Robben in Walker, Kansas. She preceded him in death on May 14, 1994. Marion married Valerie Rosenberg on January 18, 2003 in Munjor. Marion had worked for the Ellis County Road and Bridge department for thirty three years. Prior to that he had worked at the flour mill and P&B Packers. He was an avid outdoorsman particularly enjoying hunting, fishing and farming. He enjoyed his family time as well. He was a member of NRA and St. Francis of Assis Catholic Church in Munjor. He is survived by his wife, Valerie of Munjor; two sons, Timothy L. Schumacher and wife Tammy of Victoria and Corey Schumacher and wife Heather of Ellis; a daughter, Wanda Ball and husband Jack of Ellis; a brother, Ron Schumacher and wife Pat of Highlands Ranch, CO; 13 grandchildren, 16 great grandchildren and 1 great-great grandchild. Marion was preceded in death by his parents; first wife, Natalie; two sisters, Charlotte Veatch and Mary Lou Pfannenstiel as well as two infant brothers, Gerald and Dewayne. Funeral services will be 10:00 AM Friday, February 3, 2023 at St. Francis of Assisi Catholic Church in Munjor. Inurnment will follow in the church cemetery. Memorial contributions are suggested to the Hays City Sportsman Club specified for the Outdoor Youth Festival. Condolences may be left by guest book at www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com A complete obituary will be provided by Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601.

View Full Obituary

Rebecca Speier - Unknown - January 25, 2023

Departed: 01/25/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Rebecca "Becky" Speier, age 91, of Hays, Kansas passed away Wednesday, January 25, 2023 at Delmar Gardens in Overland Park, Kansas. She was born August 31, 1931 to Patrick Thigpen and Julia (Bland) Thigpen in Burgaw, North Carolina. She married William H. Speier May 31, 1951, in Fort Lee, Virginia. He preceded her in death on March 21, 1980. Becky served in the Army during the Korean War Era. After her service, she worked as a hostess at the Holiday Inn and Vagabond restaurants in Hays, Kansas for many years. She is survived by Timothy Speier, son, Hill City, KS; Robert (Paola) Ames, grandson, Manhattan, KS; Nan Ames, granddaughter, Hays, KS; Rebecca Speier, granddaughter, Los Angeles, CA; Alexandria Speier, granddaughter, San Diego, CA ; great grandchildren: Hannah, Chris, Emily and Robert Jr. Ames; Ronald Speier, nephew, Lenexa, KS; Sharon Speier, niece, Hays, KS; Julia Irene Thigpen Winborne, sister, Hartsville, SC. She was preceded in death by her husband, William Speier; a daughter, Katherine Speier; sons, David Speier and Mark Speier; her parents, Patrick and Julia Thigpen; brothers, Carl Thigpen, Thomas Thigpen, and David Thigpen. Funeral services will be 10:30 AM Friday, February 3, 2023, at Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601. Visitation will be 9:30 AM until service time. Burial with Military Honors courtesy of the Hays VFW Honor Guard will follow in St. Joseph's Cemetery, Hays. Condolences may be left by guest book at www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com.

View Full Obituary

Marjorie Boeckner - November 07, 1932 - January 10, 2023

Departed: 01/10/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Marjorie Boeckner, age 90, of Hays, Kansas died January 10, 2023, at Hays Medical Center in Hays, Kansas. She was born November 7, 1932, to Mike Loreg and Eva (Cline) Loreg in Codell, Kansas. She graduated Plainville High School, and later married Dean Boeckner in Newton, Kansas. Marjorie had a passion for caring for kids of all ages. She enjoyed big family meals and getting together brought her the most joy. She was a parent of her own children, as well as a foster parent for 20 years, taking care of a total of 184 kids, and adopting four. She had also worked at the Hillcrest Cemetery as a bookkeeper in Great Bend and was president of the Paradise Center Cemetery Board. She is survived by her children, Avea Mahan, Roeland, Park, KS: Daniel Boeckner, Hays, KS; Dean Boeckner, Jr, Hays, KS: Tammie (David) Acheson, Palco, KS; Tanya Boeckner, Hays, KS; and Jessica Boeckner, Hays, KS; sister LaDonna, Wichita, KS; brothers Mike, Hoisington, KS; Dean (Janice), Topeka, KS; and Darrell, (Janice) Clinton, MO; eight grandchildren, and 3 great grandchildren. Marjorie was preceded in death by her husband, Dean Boeckner, daughter, Thea; her parents, and siblings, Helen, Kathrine, Melvin, Della Mae, Loree, Keith, Dorothy, Joseph and a grandson, Travis Mahan.

View Full Obituary

Virgil Uhrich - Unknown - January 08, 2023

Departed: 01/08/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Virgil Leo Uhrich, age 72, of Wakeeney, Kansas, died January 8, 2023, in his home. He was born April 15, 1950, in Quinter, Kansas to Leo Benedict and Rosalia (Zerr) Uhrich. Virgil married Sharon Kay Beer September 3, 1992, in Hill City, Kansas. He served in the United States Navy during the Vietnam war as a mechanic on the USS Collett. He worked as a mechanic at Fondoble Motors in Ellis, then worked in the service department of the Norton Highway Department, then 29 years at Pepsi where he worked in the warehouse, as a route driver, and vending technician, retiring in 2009. Virgil decided to end his retirement after three days and started work for Trego County Road and Bridge. He then worked part time for Trego County Road and Bridge, as well as, Riedel Farms, retiring in 2021. In April of 2022, he was able to take part in the Coffeyville Honor Flight accompanied by his great nephew Braddix Bozarth. Virgil enjoyed woodworking, especially making toys for kids, and was well known for building many rocker glider chairs until November 2022. He liked to spend time fishing, camping, and spending time with family. He is survived by his wife, Sharon of WaKeeney; sons, Kirk (Cindy) Knouf, Quinter, KS; Chad Uhrich, Ellis, KS; daughters, Bridget (Ed) Beall, Wakeeney, KS; Collett (Andrew) Spencer, Wakeeney, KS; Kristi Grate, Tulsa, OK; Heidi (Kerrey Moore) Uhrich, McPherson, KS; brother, Dwayne (Terri) Uhrich, Norton, KS; sister Marla (Curt) Bozarth, Norton, KS; Chris (Brad) Carlin, Norcatur, KS; Monica (Brian) Roe, Hays, KS; Valerie (Phil) Babcock, Norton, KS; eight grandchildren, Sierra (Levi), Jessica, Caleb, Blake (Kenna), Nathaniel, Rylee, Kaylee, and Mason, and five great grandchildren, Ayla, Rosie, Elias, Rory, and Jax. As well as numerous nieces and nephews. He was preceded in death by his parents, an infant sister, Mary Uhrich, nephews, Lucas Welch and Riley Bozarth. Services will be held Friday, January 13, 2023 at 10:30 AM at St. Michael's Catholic Church, 711 Ainslie, Collyer, Kansas. Memorial visitation will 9:30 until service time at the church.

View Full Obituary

Terence Wierman - Unknown - January 03, 2023

Departed: 01/03/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Terence Wierman, age 79, of Hays, Kansas passed away January 3, 2023 at the Good Samaritan Society, Ellsworth Village. Arrangements are pending with Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS. 67601.

View Full Obituary

Darrell Zimmerman - April 28, 1938 - January 01, 2023

Departed: 01/01/2023 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Darrell Eugene Zimmerman, age 84 of Hays, Kansas died Sunday, January 1, 2023 at his home in Hays. Memorial Services including Military Honors will be Friday, January 6, 2023 at 2 PM at Brock's-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory, 2509 Vine Street, Hays, KS 67601. Memorials are suggested to: The Humane Society of the High Plains in care of the Funeral Chapel. Condolences may be left by guest book at www.keithleyfuneralchapels.com.

View Full Obituary

Stephen Basgall - Unknown - December 26, 2022

Departed: 12/26/2022 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Stephen Basgall, age 58, of Hays, Kansas passed away Monday, December 26, 2022 at Hays Medical Center. He was born September 17, 1964 in Hays, Kansas to Leon and Altarena (Windholz) Basgall. He graduated from LaCrosse High School in 1983. On May 4, 1985 he was united in marriage to Virginia (Dreiling) in Hays. Stephen worked for Fort Hays State University starting out in construction and currently at Sternberg Museum as a maintenance technician. Stephen enjoyed restoring and tinkering on older muscle cars with a particular fondness for 1970's Chevelle's and El Camino's. As his neighbors would tell you he enjoyed Rock "n" Roll music and he was happy to visit with all who would stop by. He also enjoyed painting and Drywalling which he learned from his father-in-law, Harry. Stephen was an avid animal lover particularly dogs and above all he was a very proud husband, father and grandfather. He is survived by his wife, Virginia of Hays; his parents, Leon and Altarena Basgall of Yocemento; his son, Kendrick Basgall and wife Shania and their son, Krew all of Olathe, Kansas; a daughter, MaRyan Hulvey and husband Nathan and their children, Parker and Airalia all of McPherson; a brother, Keith Basgall and wife Jean of Hays and a sister, Karen Thornton and husband Shon of Garden City. He was preceded in death by his grandparents, Tony and Philomena Windholz and Fidelis and Rose Basgall. Funeral services will be 10:00 AM Friday, December 30, 2022 at Immaculate Heart of Mary Church in Hays. Burial will follow in the St. Joseph Cemetery, Hays. Lora Gallegos-Haynes - Unknown - December 22, 2022

Departed: 12/22/2022 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: Lora Gallegos-Haynes, age 63 of Hays, Kansas passed away Thursday, December 22, 2022, in Hays. She was born June 19, 1959, in Denver, Colorado. On August 16, 1986, she married Thomas J. Haynes in Denver. Lora has been a Spanish teacher at Hays High for more than the past twenty years. Her involvement and passion for her students, church family and the community are widespread. She was responsible for starting the Hays International Travel Club which allowed her and students to travel internationally. To allow for the travel expenses which could take up to two years of countless fund-raising efforts were held including working concessions, wreath sales, bingo, bake sales and pizza sales. Lora and her husband, Thomas started up and operated Lomato’s Pizza in Hays which is named after the first two letters of Lora, Marie, and Tom’s names. Traveling was truly a passion for Lora and amazingly she and Tom had traveled to all 50 fifty states, the lower forty-eight states by motorcycle. She also enjoyed crafting and crocheting as well. She was a member of the New Life Center Assembly of God Church in Hays and the NEA. Lora was a caring soul who was a caregiver to so many. She was an adored teacher, friend, and adopted “Grandma” to countless students and people in the community. Lora is survived by her mother and father, Priscilla and Morris Branch of Bennett, Colorado; husband, Tom of Hays; her daughter, Marie Haynes of Overland Park, Kansas; step sons, Tim Haynes of Bison, Kansas and Terry Haynes of Hays; siblings, Morris Branch Jr. of Aurora, Colorado, Luana Branch of Bennett, Colorado, Larry Branch of Denver, Frank Madrid of Visalia, California and Rebecca Hill of Broomfield, Colorado; seven grandchildren, Talia, Elon, Jazmine, Harley, Kiran, Terrence II, and Juliet as well as eight great grandchildren, Oliver, Ronan, Tyler, Brooklyn, Razariah, Reviahna, Daunte and Aries. She was preceded in death by her grandparents, Lorenza and Eloy Gallegos and her siblings, Chana, Larry, Lupe, and Lydia. Memorial contributions are suggested to be made payable to New Life Center to be used according to the wishes of the family designated at a later date. William "Bill" Thompson - Unknown - December 19, 2022

Departed: 12/19/2022 (Hays)

Obituary Preview: William E. “Bill” Thompson, 83, of Schoenchen, Kansas died Monday, December 19, 2022, at Hays Medical Center, surrounded by his family. He was born March 11, 1939, in Bristow Oklahoma, the son of Ben and Faye (Blackmore) Thompson. Bill graduated from Codell High School in 1957. He then enlisted in the Navy and served from 1959 to 1969. He boarded the ship USS ST. Paul out of Long Beach, California, while stationed aboard, they escorted President Eisenhower. In August,1963 he was united in marriage to Janice Tinkler, they later divorced. In June 1986 he married Kathy (Munsch) Herrman they were married 36 years. Bill started his working career in the oilfield, owned a backhoe business and a donut shop and went back to oilfield as a service rig operator, driller, floor hand and pumper. He pumped wells for many oil companies, the last to be Kaiser-Francis Oil Company. He was a grain hauler for Schreiner Trucking and Golden Plains Trucking. After retiring from trucking, he then went to work for Hays Area Children Center as a custodian for 12 years, then worked at Dollar Tree as a floor stocker for two years. Bill was a joy to be around, he always had a funny remark on what others said, anyone he knew truly enjoyed and loved him. He always made everyone he saw smile and laugh, especially his sister Loretta. Bill is survived by his wife, Kathy, of 36 years; children, Jeff Thompson (Robin Johnson) Ash Grove MO; Wayne (Cheryl) Thompson, Strafford, MO; Bruce (Charlet) Thompson, Springfield, MO; Sheila (Joe) Tollen, Nixa, MO; Randy Thompson, Chicago, IL; Pam Moore, Nixa, MO; Lori (Jereme)Springer, Springfield, MO; step children, Curt Herrman (Gayla Clark), Schoenchen, KS; Kim (Gerald) Deaver, Colwich, KS; Troy (Barb) Herrman, Hutchinson, KS; twin brother, Larry (Carolyn) Thompson, Chauetau, OK; sisters Freida Dobbeke, Wichita, KS; Loretta (Leon) Ross, Plainville, KS; brother in law Bob (Karen) Munsch, Schoenchen, KS; sister in law, Jeannie Munsch (Bob Jarmer), Great Bend, KS; grandchildren, Trevor (Kaci) Thompson, Zachary Thompson, Kylie Thompson, Nathan (Grace) Thompson, Natalie Thompson, Krystal Tollen, Dustin (Kyra) Tollen, Austin Tollen, Shantel Thompson, Myron Thompson, Shala Thompson, Tyree Moore, Kaihprec Moore, Deontae Moore, Travis Springer, Olivia Springer, Kayla Springer, Step grandchildren, Gerad (Alissa) Deaver, Kelton Deaver (Victoria Allen), Kirstin Benedict, Brandon Herrman, and 8 great grandchildren, and 2 step great grandchildren. He is preceded in death by his parents, sister Della Beller, brothers in law, Ray Beller, Art Dobbeke, and Ron Munsch. Funeral services will be 10:00 AM Wednesday, December 28, 2022 at Brock’s-Keithley Funeral Chapel and Crematory 2509 Vine Hays, KS 67601. Burial with military honors courtesy of the Hays VFW Honor Guard will follow in the St. Anthony Cemetery in Schoenchen. Visitation will be Tuesday 5 PM – 8 PM and Wednesday 9 AM until service time all at the funeral chapel. An Altar Society rosary at 6:30, and prayer service at 7:00 will be Tuesday at the funeral chapel.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is an obituary?

An obituary is a written notice that announces the death of a person, typically including their name, age, date of birth and death, and a brief biography. It's often used to share information about the deceased with family, friends, and community members.

Why are obituaries important?

Obituaries serve as a way to honor and remember the deceased, while also providing essential information for those who want to pay their respects. They can also be a valuable resource for genealogists and historians.

Who typically writes an obituary?

The task of writing an obituary usually falls on the family members or close friends of the deceased. In some cases, a funeral home or crematorium may offer to write the obituary on behalf of the family.

What information should be included in an obituary?

A typical obituary includes the deceased's name, age, date of birth and death, place of residence, occupation, education, hobbies, achievements, and surviving family members. You may also include details about the funeral or memorial service.

How long should an obituary be?

The length of an obituary can vary greatly, but it's generally recommended to keep it concise and focused on the most important details. Aim for around 100-200 words.

Can I include photos in an obituary?

Yes, many newspapers and online obituary platforms allow you to include one or more photos of the deceased. This can help make the obituary more personal and engaging.

How do I submit an obituary to a newspaper?

Contact the newspaper's obituary department directly to inquire about their submission process and any specific requirements they may have. Be prepared to provide the necessary information and payment for publication.

Can I write my own obituary in advance?

Yes, some people choose to write their own obituary ahead of time. This can be a therapeutic exercise and ensure that your life story is told in your own words. However, it's essential to keep your wishes private until the time comes.

What is the difference between an obituary and a eulogy?

An obituary is a written notice announcing a person's death, while a eulogy is a speech or written tribute delivered at a funeral or memorial service. A eulogy is typically more personal and celebratory in tone.

Can I include humor in an obituary?

Absolutely! Humor can be an excellent way to capture the personality and spirit of the deceased. Just be sure to keep it respectful and tasteful.

How much does it cost to publish an obituary?

The cost of publishing an obituary varies widely depending on the newspaper, online platform, or funeral home. Expect to pay anywhere from $50 to several hundred dollars.

Can I publish an obituary online only?

Yes, there are many online platforms that allow you to publish an obituary without printing it in a physical newspaper. This can be a cost-effective option and reach a wider audience.

How long will my online obituary remain available?

This depends on the online platform or website where you published the obituary. Some websites may archive obituaries indefinitely, while others may remove them after a certain period.

In most cases, it's possible to make corrections or updates to an obituary after publication. However, this may incur additional fees or require permission from the original publisher.

What if I need to cancel or postpone a funeral service mentioned in the obituary?

Contact the newspaper or online platform immediately to request changes or corrections. You may also need to notify friends and family directly.

Can I include charitable donations or memorial funds in an obituary?

Yes, many families choose to include information about charitable donations or memorial funds in lieu of flowers. This can be a meaningful way to honor the deceased and support a worthy cause.

How do I handle condolences and guest books online?

Many online obituary platforms offer condolence books or guest books where friends and family can leave messages and memories. You can also create a separate Facebook page or memorial website for this purpose.

Can I republish an old obituary for a future anniversary or special occasion?

Yes, you can republish an old obituary on significant dates like birthdays or anniversaries of passing. This can be a touching way to remember and celebrate the life of your loved one.

Are there any specific guidelines for writing an obituary for someone who was young or died suddenly?

Yes, when writing an obituary for someone who died young or suddenly, it's essential to be sensitive and compassionate in your language. Focus on celebrating their life and accomplishments rather than dwelling on the circumstances of their death.

Can I include quotes, poems, or lyrics in an obituary?

Absolutely! Including meaningful quotes, poems, or song lyrics can add depth and personality to an obituary. Just be sure to obtain necessary permissions or credits if required.

How do I ensure accuracy when writing an obituary?

What if I'm struggling emotionally while writing an obituary?

It's normal to feel overwhelmed when writing an obituary. Take your time, seek support from friends or family members if needed, and consider taking breaks to process your emotions.

Can I write an obituary for someone who didn't have immediate family members?

Absolutely! If you're close friends with someone who passed away without immediate family members, you can still write an obituary as a way to honor their memory and share their story with others.]

About Jeffery Isleworth

Jeffery Isleworth is an experienced eulogy and funeral speech writer who has dedicated his career to helping people honor their loved ones in a meaningful way. With a background in writing and public speaking, Jeffery has a keen eye for detail and a talent for crafting heartfelt and authentic tributes that capture the essence of a person's life. Jeffery's passion for writing eulogies and funeral speeches stems from his belief that everyone deserves to be remembered with dignity and respect. He understands that this can be a challenging time for families and friends, and he strives to make the process as smooth and stress-free as possible. Over the years, Jeffery has helped countless families create beautiful and memorable eulogies and funeral speeches. His clients appreciate his warm and empathetic approach, as well as his ability to capture the essence of their loved one's personality and life story. When he's not writing eulogies and funeral speeches, Jeffery enjoys spending time with his family, reading, and traveling.
